page.title: 11COMPTON BISHOP - MENDIPS
page.content: TUCKED AWAY IN A QUITE COOMBE ON THE SOUTH SLOPES OF MENDIP,IN THE ATTRACTIVE VILLAGE OF COMPTON BISHOP OVERLOOKED ON THE WEST BY CROOK PEAK AND ON THE CAST BY WAVERING DOWN A LOOP ROAD LINKS THE VILLAGE WITH THE VALLEY ROAD. DESPITE SOME MODERN DWELLINGS,THE VILLAGE RETAINS THE CHARACTERISTICS OF A VICTORIAN SETTLEMENT.THE HOUSES ARE MAINLY BUILT OF LIMESTONE WHICH HAS NOW WEATHERED. THE VILLAGE STORES AND POST OFFICE ARE SITUATED ON THE VALLEY ROAD,APPROXIMATELY 1KM FROM THE CHURCH. THE CLIMATE IS SUCH THAT,IN THE WAR AND THE PAST WAR PERIOD,A HOME FOR YOUNG PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM THE RESULTS OF BOMBING WAS SET UP. IT IS NOW A PEACEFUL BACKWATER,A PLACE TO ENJOY LIVING.
